column4: k so if I install ubuntu 5.10 preview, can I upgrade in place when it is released?
I'm trying to decide if I should switch from Gentoo to Ubuntu. I'm totally new to linux, and have Gentoo limping along. I'm tired of mapping mouse buttons and compiling sound drivers in my kernel :)
i take it ubuntu works out of the box more?
looks like a different version of 510 that i'm downloading
breezy is not officially out yet .. the current stable release is called Hoary Hedgehog
Breezy Badger is slated to come out some time in October .. but there was a Preview Release (release candidate basically) that came out earlier this month
and the latest test version (and likely last to be compiled before the final version is out) is Colony 5
so what should i get for a new install?
well ... for guaranteed stability and compatibility with the unofficial ubuntu starter guide ... 5.04 (Hoary Hedgehog)
I'm confused because i have two pages up, both for Ubuntu 5.10 (Breezy Badger), one says Preview, one says Colony CD 5
well if you are going to install Breezy, install Colony CD 5
I take it colony 5 is just an updated preview build?
